result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius Andre Harper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.
*give DNA sample.

No new law violations.
No new retail theft tickets.

supervisions.notes:
*Court ordered the DNA sample.  All court costs, fees, assessments and DNA surcharges be paid by 6/1/2019 or civil judgment.
*The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges  be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).
Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served. To be served in the Wisconsin Prison System.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demetrius Andre Harper in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Demetrius Andre Harper in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant is serving a sentence in Dodge on a separate matter.  
Parties reviewed the sentencing memorandum.  Statements heard.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction to be served in the Wisconsin Prison System, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Court ordered the DNA sample.  All court costs, fees, assessments and DNA surcharges be paid by 6/1/2019 or civil judgment.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges  be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, received and filed.
State appointed attorney Douglas Batt failed to appear.  Sentencing after Revocation re-scheduled to 6/1/2016 at 8:30 am

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Siefert
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[    ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment
( X )  Sentence After Revocation

Defendant Demetrius Andre Harper in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Demetrius Andre Harper in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for to be determined at time of revocation
time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date. 
 Court placed defendant on probation for ONE YEAR with the following conditions:
* no new violations
* no new retail theft tickets
*pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation or civil judgment shall be  entered against the defendant  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
*give DNA sample 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Demetrius Andre Harper not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. LR  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-26-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demetrius Andre Harper not in court, defendant in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No atty appointed yet.   Court ordered case adjourned for status on counsel  in Branch  47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 07-31-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walgreens at 3201 E. Layton Ave., Cudahy, WI

Defendant Demetrius Andre Harper in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Demetrius Andre Harper in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
